dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: ¿En qué trabajas, Juan?
dialog.english: What do you work as, Juan?

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: Yo trabajo en un restaurante. Soy mesero.
dialog.english: I work in a restaurant. I am a waiter.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: ¿Y tu hermano, en qué trabaja?
dialog.english: And your brother, what does he work as?

dialog.speaker: Juan
dialog.spanish: Él es estudiante. Trabaja en una tienda por la tarde.
dialog.english: He is a student. He works in a store in the afternoon.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: Ah, yo también soy estudiante.
dialog.english: Oh, I am also a student.

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: ¿Dónde vive tu amigo David?
dialog.english: Where does your friend David live?

dialog.speaker: Laura
dialog.spanish: Él vive en la ciudad, en un apartamento pequeño.
dialog.english: He lives in the city, in a small apartment.

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: ¿Y tú, dónde vives?
dialog.english: And you, where do you live?

dialog.speaker: Laura
dialog.spanish: Yo vivo en las afueras, en una casa grande.
dialog.english: I live in the suburbs, in a big house.

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: Yo vivo en la misma calle que David.
dialog.english: I live on the same street as David.

dialog.speaker: Marcos
dialog.spanish: Tengo un perro grande y dos gatos pequeños.
dialog.english: I have one big dog and two small cats.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! ¿Y tú tienes mascotas?
dialog.english: How nice! And do you have pets?

dialog.speaker: Marcos
dialog.spanish: No, no tengo mascotas. Pero mi hermana tiene un pájaro.
dialog.english: No, I don't have pets. But my sister has a bird.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Mi hermano también tiene un pájaro. Es de color verde.
dialog.english: My brother also has a bird. It is green.

dialog.speaker: Marcos
dialog.spanish: Qué divertido. Mi hermana y su pájaro son felices.
dialog.english: How fun. My sister and her bird are happy.

dialog.speaker: Daniel
dialog.spanish: ¡Hola, Ana! ¿Cómo estás?
dialog.english: Hello, Ana! How are you?

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: Hola, Daniel. Estoy muy bien, gracias. ¿Y tú?
dialog.english: Hello, Daniel. I am very well, thank you. And you?

dialog.speaker: Daniel
dialog.spanish: Yo estoy cansado. La clase de hoy es difícil.
dialog.english: I am tired. Today's class is difficult.

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: Sí, es una clase difícil. Yo soy una estudiante.
dialog.english: Yes, it is a difficult class. I am a student.

dialog.speaker: Daniel
dialog.spanish: Yo también soy estudiante.
dialog.english: I am a student too.

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'La clase de hoy es difícil'?

dialog.speaker: Fernando
dialog.spanish: ¿A dónde vas, Lucía?
dialog.english: Where are you going, Lucía?

dialog.speaker: Lucía
dialog.spanish: Yo voy al gimnasio para hacer ejercicio.
dialog.english: I am going to the gym to exercise.

dialog.speaker: Fernando
dialog.spanish: ¿A dónde va tu amiga?
dialog.english: Where is your friend going?

dialog.speaker: Lucía
dialog.spanish: Ella va a la biblioteca a estudiar. Ella estudia mucho.
dialog.english: She is going to the library to study. She studies a lot.

dialog.speaker: Fernando
dialog.spanish: Yo voy al trabajo ahora. ¡Adiós!
dialog.english: I am going to work now. Goodbye!

sentences.spanish: Yo soy un estudiante y vivo en un apartamento pequeño.
sentences.english: I am a student and I live in a small apartment.

sentences.spanish: Por la mañana, yo voy a la universidad. Mi clase empieza a las nueve.
sentences.english: In the morning, I go to the university. My class starts at nine.

sentences.spanish: En la universidad, yo hablo con mis amigos y yo estudio mucho.
sentences.english: At the university, I speak with my friends and I study a lot.

sentences.spanish: Yo como el almuerzo a la una. Hoy yo como una ensalada.
sentences.english: I eat lunch at one. Today I am eating a salad.

sentences.spanish: Tengo un examen mañana, por eso yo estoy cansado.
sentences.english: I have an exam tomorrow, that's why I am tired.

sentences.spanish: Yo trabajo en una tienda por la tarde, de cinco a siete.
sentences.english: I work in a store in the afternoon, from five to seven.

sentences.spanish: Yo estoy muy ocupado, pero soy feliz.
sentences.english: I am very busy, but I am happy.

sentences.spanish: Mi nuevo amigo se llama Mario. Él es de México.
sentences.english: My new friend is named Mario. He is from Mexico.

sentences.spanish: Él vive en una casa grande en mi calle.
sentences.english: He lives in a big house on my street.

sentences.spanish: Él tiene un perro y un gato, y ellos son muy bonitos.
sentences.english: He has a dog and a cat, and they are very pretty.

sentences.spanish: Mario trabaja en una oficina. Él trabaja mucho.
sentences.english: Mario works in an office. He works a lot.

sentences.spanish: Por las tardes, él va al parque y habla con sus amigos.
sentences.english: In the afternoons, he goes to the park and speaks with his friends.

sentences.spanish: A él le gusta mucho comer pizza. Él come pizza los viernes.
sentences.english: He really likes to eat pizza. He eats pizza on Fridays.

sentences.spanish: Él es muy simpático y siempre está feliz.
sentences.english: He is very nice and is always happy.

sentences.spanish: ¿Qué comes para el desayuno?
sentences.english: What do you eat for breakfast?

sentences.spanish: Tú trabajas en la universidad, ¿verdad?
sentences.english: You work at the university, right?

sentences.spanish: Tú vives en un apartamento con tu familia.
sentences.english: You live in an apartment with your family.

sentences.spanish: ¿Cuántos libros tienes? ¿Tú tienes muchos libros?
sentences.english: How many books do you have? Do you have many books?

sentences.spanish: Tú vas al cine los fines de semana. Te gusta ver películas.
sentences.english: You go to the cinema on weekends. You like to watch movies.

sentences.spanish: ¿Cómo estás hoy? Tú estás feliz, ¿no?
sentences.english: How are you today? You are happy, right?

sentences.spanish: Tú eres una persona muy interesante.
sentences.english: You are a very interesting person.
